titles.title: Stop the Revolving Door in Washington Act
To amend title 18, United States Code, to strengthen the post-employment restrictions for Members of Congress.

bill.summary: 5/5/2009--Introduced. Stop the Revolving Door in Washington Act - Amends the federal criminal code regarding the two-year ban on lobbying contacts by former Senators with any member, officer, or employee of either chamber, or employee of any other legislative office. Imposes the two-year lobbying ban on all former Members of Congress. Continues the one-year ban, as under current law, on lobbying contacts by former elected officers of the House of Representatives with any House Member, officer, or employee.
